tweets.text: We're mounting a wide-ranging investigation into reports of damage to the #RiverLugg, which is protected through SSSI status. We're treating this very seriously, working with @NaturalEngland & @ForestryComm who have taken immediate action to prevent any further works at the site. https://t.co/bvhnTETfal

@JustinFrenchBr1 @Blacky_Himself @EnvAgency That Justin is exactly where we separate. It is the board's job to manage the CEO and it is the board's job to ensure that the organisation is capable of not only operating effectively but delivering on its goals and objectives. 

If the board aren't up to that job they should go

Horrific damage on stretch of River Lugg in #Herefordshire 
Same day, local Tory MP requested an amendment to #EnvironmentBill to 'disregard long-term consequences of level phosphates in water'
?

tweets.text:
BEFORE & AFTER

Appalling #EcoVandalism at The #RiverLugg SSSI #Herefordshire

THIS IS ILLEGAL ACTIVITY

urls.title: Horror at destruction of nationally important UK river | The Wildlife Trusts
urls.description: Major damage to River Lugg in Herefordshire will be test case for Government commitment to strengthen wildlife protection.

tweets.text:
A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW

Don't forget; if you're a landowner or farmer of Priority Catchments in Yorks & the North East, you should be eligible for top-up funding to the existing #WoodlandCreation grants. This will pay toward an Advisor to develop plans in collaboration with @EnvAgencyYNE Coordinators.1/ https://t.co/dAUzpVhyc7 https://t.co/M6g0RgrN9o

When certain things happen, it's easy (and fair) to be angry with @EnvAgency but even @Feargal_Sharkey will agree coal-face EA staff, especially in Fisheries & Biodiversity teams are hard working, passionate people doing hard jobs. It's the backbone of the top brass that fail us

.@EnvAgencyMids is calling for those responsible for stripping away trees from a mile of the River Lugg to be prosecuted. 
@HerefordshireWT says decades of damage has been done, destroying an important habitat for fish, birds and mammals. https://t.co/8NHPrlu2m9

Flooding is the main climate-related threat facing the UK. If your business has been affected by flooding, please complete this survey - https://t.co/1zQN9z5Ye2 - for a chance to win an M&S voucher. #SMEs 
@ERfloodrisk @EnvAgencyYNE @WestYorkshireCA https://t.co/JLxe3p96Sz

urls.title: Browse: Flooding and extreme weather - GOV.UK

tweets.text:
Outdated flood sirens in Grimsby and Cleethorpes will not be used from 31 December.

Instead, the Flood Warning Service reaches more people with better information and is the best way to stay alert. Sign up https://t.co/SAcXCYjoCa

Read more https://t.co/apYdmzTrnS #Lincolnshire https://t.co/HpRrLAgbWu
River Lugg in severe flood. Hoping it doesn't reach me but sadly the cottages by the river bridge are flooding #kingsland  #Herefordshire  #StormDennis https://t.co/SQ5gDJGMkD

Firstly, I found the site on sat maps (wasn't sure of the exact 'before' view). The water course flow remains the same but the banks stabilised by vegetation +substantial roots are gone. The ground level is not raised or banked higher. Habitat gone. 2/3 https://t.co/39Ae5owgWU

@grahamhrtn @CraigBennett3 @SteveCJjones @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK @WildlifeTrusts @timthefruit has posted other pictures on his timeline, the damage appears to stretch further and is worse than the photos above show

7 years ago this week, our region faced the highest tidal surge in 60 years - affecting over 400 properties in the area. Flooding is a real threat to our community but here at the #FIC, we're helping mitigate the risk of flooding through #Innovation and #Collaboration... https://t.co/kRqpQxHq0q

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.
